name: APT-C-36
descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) is a suspected South America espionage group that has been active since at least 2018. The group mainly targets Colombian government institutions as well as important corporations in the financial sector, petroleum industry, and professional manufacturing.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has embedded a VBScript within a malicious Word document which is executed upon the document opening.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has downloaded binary data from a specified domain after the malicious document is opened.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has disguised its scheduled tasks as those used by Google.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Standard Port
technique_table_data.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has used port 4050 for C2 communications.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has used ConfuserEx to obfuscate its variant of [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434), compressed payload and RAT packages, and password protected encrypted email attachments to avoid detection.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) obtained and used a modified variant of [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434).(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has used spearphishing emails with password protected RAR attachment to avoid being detected by the email gateway.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has used a macro function to set scheduled tasks, disguised as those used by Google.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [APT-C-36](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0099) has prompted victims to accept macros in order to execute the subsequent payload.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019.description: QiAnXin Threat Intelligence Center. (2019, February 18). APT-C-36: Continuous Attacks Targeting Colombian Government Institutions and Corporations. Retrieved May 5, 2020.
